contentrichtext.text: {{one source|date=February 2012}} {{no footnotes|date=February 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2011}} :''"Carloman II" might refer to the second Carolingian of that name, otherwise known as [[Carloman I]].'' {{Infobox royalty|monarch |name=Carloman II |title=King of Western Francia |image=Denier de Carloman II.jpg |caption=A ''[[denarius]]'' minted under Carloman II |reign=879–884 |coronation=September 879 in [[Ferrières-en-Gâtinais]] |cor-type=france |othertitles= |full name= |predecessor=[[Louis the Stammerer|Louis II]] |successor=[[Charles the Fat]] |consort= |royal house=[[Carolingian]] |royal anthem = |father=[[Louis the Stammerer|Louis II]] |mother=[[Ansgarde of Burgundy]] |birth_date=866 |birth_place= |death_date=12 December 884 |death_place= |place of burial =[[Saint Denis Basilica]], Paris, France |}} '''Carloman II''' (c. 866 – 12 December 884), [[king of France|King of Western Francia]], was the youngest son of King [[Louis the Stammerer]] and [[Ansgarde of Burgundy]], and became king, jointly with his brother [[Louis III of France]], on his father's death in 879. [[File:Empire carolingien en 880.svg|thumb|left|150px|Francia:<br> the realm of Carloman II after the division of March 880 is shown in blue]] Some nobles advocated electing a sole king, but eventually both brothers were elected kings. Although doubts were cast upon their legitimacy, the brothers obtained recognition and in March 880 divided their father's realm at [[Amiens]], Carloman receiving [[Kingdom of Burgundy|Burgundy]] and [[Aquitaine]]. However, Duke [[Boso of Provence|Boso]] had renounced his allegiance to both brothers and had been elected [[King of Burgundy|King of Provence]]. In the summer of 880 the brothers Carloman and [[Louis III of France|Louis]] marched against him, took [[Mâcon]] and the northern parts of Boso's realm. They united their forces with those of [[Charles the Fat]] and unsuccessfully besieged [[Vienne, Isère|Vienne]] from August to November. Only in the summer of 882, Vienne was taken after being besieged by [[Richard, Duke of Burgundy|Richard]], Count of Autun. About the same time, in August 882, Carloman became sole king owing to his brother's death, but the kingdom was in a deplorable condition partly owing to incursions from the [[Normans|Norman]] raiders, and his power was very circumscribed. There were revolts of the feudal lords even in Burgundy. Carloman met his death while hunting on 12 December 884 and was succeeded in the rule by his cousin, the Emperor [[Charles the Fat]]. ==References== {{Commons category|Carloman II of France}} *{{1911}} {{s-start}} {{s-hou|[[Carolingian Dynasty]]|c.|866|12 December|884|name=Carloman II}} {{s-bef|before=[[Louis the Stammerer|Louis II]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[List of French monarchs|King of Western Francia]]|years=10 April 879 – 12 December 884|regent1=[[Louis III of France|Louis III]]|years1=10 April 879 – 5 August 882}} {{s-aft|after=[[Charles the Fat]]}} {{s-end}} {{Carolingians footer}} {{French Carolingians}} {{Monarchs of France}} {{France topics}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Carloman 02 Of France | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 884 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Carloman 02 Of France}} [[Category:860s births]] [[Category:Kings of France]] [[Category:884 deaths]] [[Category:Carolingian dynasty]] [[Category:French monarchs]] [[Category:Medieval child rulers]] [[Category:Roman Catholic monarchs]] [[Category:Burials at the Basilica of St Denis]] [[Category:Year of birth uncertain]] [[Category:9th-century monarchs in Europe]] [[Category:Accidental deaths in France]] [[Category:Hunting accident deaths]]
